person.persName: John Rhodes Viley (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer, banker, major and quartermaster (C.S.A.))

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer, banker, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Willie Viley and Carrie C. Hall Viley. Married to Mary S. Johnson Viley in Scott County, Kentucky, on November 27, 1843. Father of John F. Viley, Willa Viley, and Bettie F. Viley. Farmer in Washington County, Mississippi, in 1850. Owned forty-seven enslaved persons in Washington County in 1850. Employed Samuel E. Roberts as an overseer in Washington County in 1850. President of the Lexington Racing Association in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1855. Director of the Northern Bank of Kentucky in Fayette County in 1857. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Director of the Northern Bank of Kentucky in Fayette County in 1860. Director of the Northern Bank of Kentucky in Fayette County until 1862. Served in the First Kentucky Brigade, Lewis's Brigade, and Bate's Division of the Army of Tennessee (C.S.A.) as major and quartermaster from October 25, 1862, to April 25, 1865.
